Dear Mrs. Fernandez:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
07/01/2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the ISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4111 Job description.
An institution shall provide a job description for each staff
position that identifies rules, required qualifications, and lines of
authority.
One out of 22 new employee records reviewed did not contain a job description.
Repeat Citation from 07/06/2018 Renewal Inspection
Repeat Citation from 08/20/2019 Interim Inspection
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(c) Verification of high school diploma or GED when
specified by rule.
Two out of 22 new employee records reviewed did not contain verification of high
school diploma or GED at time of hire. The facility indicates it was due to the
pandemic and inability to access the schools. One employee submitted their
verification in 07/2020, whereas the other employee has yet to submit their
verification.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(f) A record of any convictions other than minor traffic
violations from either of the following entities:
(i) Directly from the Michigan state police or the
equivalent state law enforcement agency, Canadian province, or
other country where the person usually resides or has resided in
the previous 5 years.
4

(ii) From an entity accessing either Michigan state police
records or equivalent state, Canadian provincial, or other
country law enforcement agency where the person usually
resides or has resided in the previous 5 years.
Four out of 22 new employee records reviewed did not complete the requirements of
this rule. One employee was hired on 09/04/2019, whereas the ICHAT was
completed on 09/17/2019. The second employee is noted to have worked in NV
from 03/2018 through 04/2019 though no out-of-state clearance was noted in the
record. The facility removed the employee from the work schedule until the out-of-
state criminal clearance check is obtained. The third and fourth employee contained
ICHAT’s that stated “Search results for this person are expired. Please perform the
search again”. Second searches were not complete until five and six months after
the initial search.
Repeat Citation from 07/06/2018 Renewal Inspection
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan department of human
services, the equivalent state or Canadian provincial agency, or
equivalent agency in the country where the person usually
resides, that the person has not been determined to be a
perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect. The documentation
shall be completed not more than 30 days prior to the start of
employment and every 12 months thereafter.
5

Three out of 22 new employee records reviewed did not complete the requirements
of this rule. Two employee records did not contain evidence of central registry
checks. The facility removed the employees from the work schedule until cleared
central registry checks have been obtained. The third employee record contained a
completed central registry clearance two months before the date of hire.
Five out of six employee records reviewed and employed more than one year
contained either late or deficient annual central registry checks. Two were late by
one and six days, whereas two remain missing by four and five months. One
employee record has not received an update since 2018. The facility removed the
employee from the work schedule until an updated central registry clearance is
completed.
Repeat Citation from 07/06/2018 Renewal Inspection
Repeat Citation from 08/20/2019 Interim Inspection
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(j) A written evaluation of the employee's performance within
30 days of the completion of the probationary period or within
180 days, whichever is less, and a written evaluation of the
employee’s performance annually thereafter.
Nine out of 22 applicable new employee records reviewed did contain a 180-day
performance evaluation.
One out of six employees hired more than one year did not contained an annual
performance evaluation that was not signed by either the employee or supervisor.
Repeat Citation from 07/06/2018 Renewal Inspection
R 400.4114 Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers.
The licensee shall document, prior to employment, that each
employee and volunteer who has contact with residents 4 or
more hours per week for more than 2 consecutive weeks is free
from communicable tuberculosis. Freedom from communicable
tuberculosis shall be verified within the 1-year period before
6

employment and shall be verified every 1 year after the last
verification or prior to the expiration of the current verification.
Two out of 22 applicable new employee records reviewed did contain verification of
being TB-free prior to hire. One staff was hired on 04/15/2020, whereas the TB test
was administered on 04/21/2020 without the results being confirmed. The second
staff record contained a 03/27/2019 administered TB test with no results, as well as
missing an annual update.
Four out of six employees hired more than one year either did not contain an annual
performance evaluation or was late. One employee record was seven months late
in completing the TB test. One employee record’s last TB test occurred on 04/2018,
and the other two were completed on 02/2019 and 03/2019.
Repeat Citation from 07/06/2018 Renewal Inspection
Repeat Citation from 08/20/2019 Interim Inspection

facility is in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the

Two out of eight applicable open case records reviewed, and one closed case
record, contained information not uploaded into MiSACWIS to include an initial
intake form, two initial health assessments, and one signature on a closing
summary. It is noted that the required information was present in the hard files.
Repeat Citation form 08/20/2019 Interim Inspection
RFCJJ Contract Services to be Provided-Related Services-Psychiatric Services-
2.10.y.2b, p. 26 Psychiatric Assessment
b) Within 45 calendar days of the youth’s placement, the
psychiatrist must assess the youth and coordinate with the
licensed clinical personnel completing the psychosocial
assessment. A review of the youth’s medication history and
current needs and prescription or adjustment of medications
and dosage as necessary must occur. Tele psychiatry may be
used when a local psychiatrist is not available.
One out of eight applicable case records reviewed contained a late psychiatric
evaluation. The resident was placed on 08/21/2019, whereas the evaluation was
completed on 11/22/2019, 17 days late.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(g) If the employee has criminal convictions, the institution shall
complete a written evaluation of the convictions that addresses
the nature of the conviction, the length of time since the
conviction, and the relationship of the conviction to regulated
activity for the purpose of determining suitability for employment
in the institution.
One employee was hired on 01/15/2020 with an ICHAT indicating that it needed to
be run again. The 06/29/2020 ICHAT indicated an arrest on 03/14/2020 with no
charge or judicial section being noted. Though no evidence of charges or
8

convictions were noted the facility should still assess the arrest as it occurred after
date of hire and upon receipt of the results.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The 07/06/2018 renewal inspection report resulted in an approved corrective action
plan dated 07/11/2018. Current repeat citations from the 2018 inspection include the
following: Job description (1), annual central registry clearances (2), performance
evaluations (1), TB tests (2 late/1 not there), out-of-state criminal records checks.
The 08/20/2019 interim inspection report resulted in an approved corrective action
plan dated 09/05/2019. Current repeat citations from the 2019 inspection include the
following: Job description, annual central registry checks and TB tests, and
MiSACWIS uploads.
SIR#2018C0219061 initiated on 07/31/2018 cited the facility for behavior
management in which staff pulled a resident by his feet to his bedroom and placed on
an unwarranted seclusion. The corrective action plan included staff review of
behavior management techniques and appropriate use of seclusion, followed by staff
testing.
SIR#2018C0219062 initiated on 07/30/2018 cited the facility for behavior
management regarding transport technique. The corrective action plan included
additional staff training on the primary restraint techniques transport. Behavior
management technique is a repeat citation from SIR#2018C0219061 though not
similar in situation.
SIR#2019C0219006 initiated on 12/14/2018 cited the facility for staff qualifications
regarding antagonizing and flinging a resident to the floor for a minor infraction. The
corrective action plan included the termination of staff, retraining staff on child
protection, as well as revamping hiring questions.
SIR#2019C0219028 initiated on 04/18/2019 cited the facility for staff not informing
administration that a resident may have texted a female staff. The corrective action
plan included all staff completing professional boundaries training regarding incidental
client contact reporting.
9

SIR#2019C0219045 initiated on 08/19/2019 cited the facility for supervision of
residents during visiting room phone calls. The corrective action plan included
security personnel being trained on the visitation policy and supervisor’s making
unannounced walk-throughs of the visitation area during phone-calls.
SIR#2020C0219019 initiated on 01/31/2020 cited the facility for staff late in
completing 15-minute bed checks though being trained, written policy regarding bed-
checks during non-sleep times, video surveillance policy’s, and surveillance
obstructions. The corrective action plan included staff suspensions, room monitoring
policy and procedure updates with retraining, supervisor monitoring, and security
review of camera obstructions and procedures. Staff qualifications is a repeat citation
from SIR#2019C0219006 though not similar in situation, as well as repeat citations
with program statement for SIR#2019C0219028 and SIR#2020C0219029.
SIR#2020C0219029 initiated on 04/21/2020 cited the facility for staff violating the
professional boundaries policy by engaging in social media contact with a resident
while on home visits and not informing administration. This is a repeat citation from
SIR#2019C0219028 though more sever. The corrective action plan included
termination of staff, administration training on professional boundaries with
development of competency test in which staff are taught and tested quarterly.
10

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
The facility was unable to schedule an environmental health inspection due to the
pandemic. The last inspection occurred on 06/25/2018 and received an “A” rating. The
facility will schedule and provide results of an updated environmental health inspection
once able to be scheduled.
